meanings.definition: The quantitative analysis of the form and structure of organisms.
meanings.sent1: In morphometries, scientists measure and analyze the shapes of animals.
meanings.sent2: Researchers used morphometries to study the sizes of different plants.
meanings.sent3: The class had a fun project where they used morphometries to compare the shapes of fruits.
meanings.sent4: Her expertise in morphometries allowed her to see the world in a new dimension.
meanings.sent5: Through morphometries, the intricate details of nature become clearer.

meanings.definition: The measurement of the dimensions of an object or organism.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used morphometries to precisely measure the length of the fish.
meanings.sent2: Morphometries helped in determining the exact size of the rock samples.
meanings.sent3: The students giggled as they tried to use morphometries to measure the height of a balloon.
meanings.sent4: His skill in morphometries was like having a ruler for everything in nature.
meanings.sent5: With morphometries, the world's dimensions are at your fingertips.

meanings.definition: The study of the size and shape of biological structures.
meanings.sent1: Through morphometries, researchers explore the shapes of leaves and petals.
meanings.sent2: The biologist's work involved using morphometries to analyze the shapes of cells.
meanings.sent3: The children found it amusing to learn about morphometries and how it relates to the shapes of animals.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for morphometries made her see the world as a collection of shapes waiting to be measured.
meanings.sent5: Morphometries transforms biology into a study of forms and sizes.
